text.p: SUMMARY NOTICE OF SALE
THE CURATORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI
CAPITAL PROJECTS NOTES,
SERIES FY 1997-98
The Curators of the University of Missouri (the

University''), invites sealed proposals for the purchase of its $95,000,000 Capital Projects Notes, Series FY 1997-98 (the Notes''). Each bid must be enclosed in an envelope securely sealed and marked Bid for the Purchase of Notes'' and addressed to The Curators of the University of Missouri and filed with the Executive Vice President of the
University at the offices of Stern Brothers & Co., 8000 Maryland Avenue, Suite 1020, St. Louis, Missouri 63105. All bids must be received at or before 10:30 A.M., Central Daylight Savings Time, on
Tuesday, June 10, 1997

and bids so received will be opened at such time and place and the apparent best bid will be determined by the Executive Committee (the Executive Committee '') of the Board of Curators of the University of the State of Missouri (the Board''), the governing body of the University, based on the lowest true interest cost to the University. The Executive Committee will meet at 12:00 Noon, Central
Daylight Savings Time, on Tuesday, June 10, 1997, to award the bid for sale of the Notes.

The Notes shall be issued in fully registered form and, when issued, the Notes will be registered in the name of Cede & Co., as Noteowner and nominee for The Depository Trust Company, New York, New York (DTC''). DTC will act as securities depository for the Notes. Purchases of the Notes will be made in book-entry only form in the denomination of $5,000 or integral multiples thereof. Purchasers will not receive certificates representing their interest in Notes purchased.

The Notes shall be dated July 1, 1997 and shall mature on June 30, 1998. The Notes shall bear interest at the rates to be determined when the Notes are sold as hereinafter provided. Interest will be payable on the date of maturity and shall be calculated on the basis of a 365 day year and actual days elapsed (i.e., 364/365). It is anticipated that the Notes will be available for delivery at DTC on July 1, 1997.
The Notes shall not be subject to redemption by the University prior to maturity.

The Notes are being issued by the University pursuant to the Constitution and laws of the state of Missouri and a resolution adopted by the Board on March 20, 1997, as supplemented by a resolution to be adopted by the Executive Committee on June 10, 1997 (collectively, the
Resolution''). The Notes will constitute limited
obligations of the University payable solely from, and secured as to the payment of principal and interest on the

Notes by a pledge of the University's Current Funds defined in the Resolution (generally, state appropriations for general operations, student fee revenue, and other undesignated Current Funds) for the University's fiscal year ending June 30, 1998.

In order to assist bidders in complying with S.E.C. Rule 15c2-12(b)(5), the University will undertake, pursuant to the Resolution and a Continuing Disclosure Agreement, to provide notices of the occurrence of certain events, if material. A description of this undertaking is set forth in the Preliminary Official Statement and will also be set forth in the Final Official Statement.

All bids must be submitted on forms prepared on behalf of the University which may be procured from the undersigned, or from Stern Brothers & Co., the Financial Advisor to the University, at the addresses referred to herein. The forms submitted must contain the original signature of an

authorized representative of the bidder. No additions or alterations to said forms shall be made and erasures thereto may cause rejection of any bid. The University reserves the right to waive irregularities and to reject any or all bids and to determine not to sell the Notes for any reason it, in its sole discretion, deems appropriate. THE FINANCIAL
ADVISOR TO THE UNIVERSITY WILL BE UNABLE TO SUBMIT A BID FOR THE NOTES ON BEHALF OF ANY BIDDER.

Proposals will be received on the Notes bearing such rate of interest, expressed as a per-annum percentage rate, as may be specified by the bidders, subject to the following conditions: Each bid must offer to purchase all of the Notes. No bid for less than 100% of the principal amount of the Notes will be considered. The same rate of interest shall apply to all Notes. The rate of interest bid may not exceed six percent (6.0%) per annum. The rate of interest specified shall be a multiple of 1/8 or 1/20 of 1%. No supplemental interest payments will be authorized. Each bid shall specify the total interest cost during the life of the Note issue, the premium, if any, offered by the bidder, the net interest cost expressed in dollars, and the true interest cost expressed as a per-annum percentage rate, each on the basis of such bid.

Each bid shall be accompanied by a CASHIER'S, CERTIFIED OR OFFICIAL CHECK in immediately available funds, drawn upon a bank located in the United States and payable to the order of the University in the amount of One Million Nine Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1,900,000), as evidence of good faith, to secure the University from any loss resulting from the failure of the bidder to comply with the terms of its bid. The Notes will be sold subject to the approving legal opinion of Thompson Coburn, St. Louis, Missouri, Bond Counsel, whose opinion will be furnished and paid for by the University. The University has prepared a Preliminary
Official Statement dated May 23, 1997, which is deemed final within the meaning of Rule 15c2-12 of the Securities and
Exchange Commission except for items permitted to excluded by said rule.
Additional information, copies of the Preliminary Official Statement and bid forms may be obtained from the
undersigned, or from Stern Brothers & Co., 8000 Maryland Avenue, Suite 1020, St. Louis, Missouri 63105, Attention: Donald A. Estell (314-727-5519).
Dated: May 23, 1997.
THE CURATORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI
By /s/ James T. McGill
Executive Vice President
215 University Hall
Columbia, Missouri 65211
(From The Bond Buyer)
